The winner of The Voice Season 27 was crowned on May 20 after finalists Adam David and Jadyn Cree from Team Michael Bublé, Renzo from Team John Legend, Jaelen Johnston from Team Kelsea Ballerini, and Lucia Flores-Wiseman from Team Adam Levine competed one last time for America's votes. (Read our minute-by-minute recap.) More from GoldDerby Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement At the end of Tuesday's live finale, host Carson Daly announced that Adam was the winner, Jaelen was the runner-up, Renzo placed third, Lucia came in fourth, and Jadyn finished fifth. That made coach Michael a two-time champion in as many seasons, after prevailing with Sofronio Vasquez in Season 26. By claiming victory, Adam broke the long-standing Instant Save curse, as he was previously saved by online support. (One prior winner, Season 22's Bryce Leatherwood, earned the Wild Card vote during his competition, but it wasn't technically the same twist as the Instant Save.) SEE‘The Voice’ winners: All seasons Just one week ago, the Top 12 were cut down to the Top 5 on live television, and Adam placed in the middle part of those results, alongside Olivia Kuper Harris, Iris Herrera, and Bryson Battle. Viewers voted feverishly to keep Adam via The Voice App, which resulted in him becoming a finalist, while Olivia, Iris, and Bryson were all sent home. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Additionally, Adam is now the third winner in the history of NBC's reality TV show to only receive a single chair turn in the blind auditions. The other one-chair turns were Season 12's Chris Blue (Team Alicia Keys) and Season 17's Jake Hoot (Team Kelly Clarkson). "I love you, man," Michael Bublé told Adam David just moments before the confetti fell during the finale. "You're my kind of artist. I love you, and congratulations. I know you can do it." The 34-year-old from Fort Lauderdale, Fla. performed the following songs during the competition: "Baby, I Love Your Way," "Home," "Unaware," "I Shall Be Released," "Bring It on Home to Me," "Hard Fought Hallelujah," "You Are So Beautiful" (watch above) and "The Weight" (his coach duet). Adam also won Gold Derby's poll that asked fans who should win The Voice, with a leading 23.25 percent. He was followed by Jadyn at 21.8 percent, Renzo at 19.4 percent, Lucia at 19 percent, and Jaelen at 16.4 percent. Do you agree or disagree with the finale results? The Voice Crowns New Champion in Shocking Finale+++++ In a dramatic showdown on May 20, Adam David clinched victory on The Voice Season 27, edging out Jaelen Johnston in a twist no one saw coming. Meanwhile, Lucia Flores-Wiseman and Jadyn Cree were left wondering if they should have brought snacks for the judges.+++++ After a season full of “I’m too good for this chair” moments, Michael Bublé celebrated his second consecutive win, joining the exclusive club of coaches who love giant golden trophies almost as much as their vocalists. Jaelen, our ever-so-sporting runner-up, is regrettably still waiting for that next big break.+++++ In a shocking twist, Adam’s victory broke the infamous Instant Save curse—unless you count the guy from Season 22 who was saved with a Wild Card, which is totally different in absolutely no logical way. Yes, because singing really does save everything...except for a normal life post-reality TV.+++++ Just a week prior, Adam was among a sea of twelve contestants anxiously waiting, perhaps for someone to finally hand them snacks backstage. But alas, he pulled through to the finale, leaving our sweet trio of Olivia, Iris, and Bryson sobbing with popcorn leftovers. The heartwarming drama could practically be seen from space!+++++ In a shocking statistic, Adam joins the exclusive “one-chair turn” club, now alongside Chris Blue and Jake Hoot. Apparently, there's something magical about being the underdog, like winning the lottery while buying a single ticket—which honestly sounds like my kind of luck!+++++ As Michael Bublé showered Adam with compliments before the confetti fell, America sighed collectively, “Finally, my heart can rest.” And amidst the glitter and cheers, one question lingered: What on earth will next season bring? Maybe an alien-themed episode where contestants sing to extraterrestrials? Stay tuned!+++++

Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem ordered her department to terminate Harvard’s Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) certification, citing the university’s refusal to turn over the conduct records of foreign students requested by the DHS last month. The decision could impact more than a quarter of Harvard’s heavily international student body, who have been flung into anxiety and confusion by the announcement. Professors warn a mass exodus of foreign students threatens to stifle the academic prowess of the institution even as it battles against the administration for its ideological autonomy. The White House said Thursday that “enrolling foreign students is a privilege, not a right” and accused Harvard leadership of turning “their once-great institution into a hot-bed of anti-American, anti-Semitic, pro-terrorist agitators.” “They have repeatedly failed to take action to address the widespread problems negatively impacting American students and now they must face the consequences of their actions,” White House spokesperson Abigail Jackson said in a statement to CNN. Harvard and Trump officials have been locked in conflict for months as the administration demands the university make changes to campus programming, policies, hiring and admissions to root out on-campus antisemitism and eliminate what it calls “racist ‘diversity, equity and inclusion’ practices.” The administration has homed in on foreign students and staff it believes participated in contentious campus protests over the Israel-Hamas war. But the university’s leadership argues many of the requests, including an “audit” of the “viewpoint” of its students and staff, go far beyond the role of the federal government and may violate Harvard’s constitutional rights. Harvard is among dozens of US universities facing similar demands from the Trump administration, but it has emerged as the fiercest defender of its academic independence. The university swiftly condemned the SEVP revocation as “unlawful,” saying in a statement it is “fully committed to maintaining Harvard’s ability to host international students and scholars, who hail from more than 140 countries and enrich the University – and this nation – immeasurably.” “We are working quickly to provide guidance and support to members of our community. This retaliatory action threatens serious harm to the Harvard community and our country, and undermines Harvard’s academic and research mission,” university spokesperson Jason Newton said. The university has an enormous foreign student population that could be impacted. It says it has 9,970 people in its international academic population, and data shows 6,793 international students comprise 27.2% of its enrollment in the 2024-25 academic year.

Trump's Harvard Ban Leaves International Students in Limbo+++++ In a stunning move, the Trump administration has revoked Harvard University's right to admit international students, throwing over 9,970 anxious scholars into a whirlwind of bureaucratic chaos. Those foreign students left standing now face a hard choice: transfer or say goodbye to their legal status. Talk about a real-life educational cliffhanger!+++++ Citing a refusal to disclose the conduct records of foreign students, Homeland Security declared its ultimate punishment, leaving professors fretting about the possible loss of 27.2% of the student body. This action has sparked debates hotter than your average Harvard coffee—how will the university keep its academic glow?+++++ The White House chimed in, stating that “enrolling foreign students is a privilege, not a right,” as if that logic finally solves all our problems. Meanwhile, spokesperson Abigail Jackson claimed Harvard had transformed into "anti-American" territory, as if the Ivy League haven was secretly plotting world domination. Rumor has it they’re also auditioning for a reality show!+++++ Amid this swirling storm, Harvard stands firmly against the demands, pointing out that the requests for an “audit” of student viewpoints are, frankly, a bit too much like a jilted relationship asking for all your friend’s passwords. After all, academic independence isn’t just a motto; it’s practically their superhero cape!+++++ The university’s leadership declared the SEVP revocation “unlawful,” promising to uphold its legacy of hosting international talent from over 140 countries. As word spreads, you can almost hear the collective gasp of confusion from those aspiring scholars, wondering if they should pack for a new institution or look into studying at Hogwarts instead. Because who doesn't love a little magic when reality bites?+++++
